title: Gallery: 10 years ago today, Paul Konerko hits World Series grand slam
text:
Ten years ago today , Paul Konerko hit a World Series grand slam that helped propel the White Sox to a Game 2 win over the Astros.
In the same game, Scott Podsednik hit a walk-off home run:
The Sox went on to win the series in four games to capture their first world championship since 1917.
23 of the best photos from the 2005 World Series: Start Slideshow Â» Catcher A.J. Pierzynski #12 hugs pitcher Bobby Jenks #45 as they and the rest of the Chicago White Sox celebrate after winning Game 4 of the 2005 Major League Baseball World Series against the Houston Astros at Minute Maid Park on October 26, 2005 in Houston, Texas. The Chicago White Sox defeated the Houston Astros 1-0 to win the World Series 4 games to 0. (Photo by Ronald Martinez/Getty Images)
Chicago White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen speaks with the media before the start of Game One of the 2005 Major League Baseball World Series against the Houston Astros at U.S. Celluar Field on October 22, 2005 in Chicago, Illinois. (Photo by Jed Jacobsohn/Getty Images)
The Chicago White Sox pass around the Championship trophy after winning Game 4 of the 2005 Major League Baseball World Series against the Houston Astros at Minute Maid Park on October 26, 2005 in Houston, Texas. The Chicago White Sox defeated the Houston Astros 1-0 to win the World Series 4 games to 0. (Photo by Jed Jacobsohn/Getty Images)
